cluster_relations.rel_desc: Ancient Egyptian burial practices are an expression of their afterlife beliefs.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Links a cultural practice or custom to the underlying cultural belief, value, or attitude that it expresses or manifests.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Ancient Egyptian burial practices manifest the culture's reverence for the deceased.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (a practice, artifact, or behavior) serves as an expression or manifestation of the object (a belief, value, or attitude).

args.canonical_rel_desc: Links a cultural practice, custom, or ritual to the underlying cultural belief, value, or attitude that it expresses or manifests.
args.justification: All three relations connect ancient Egyptian burial practices to underlying beliefs or values they manifest (afterlife beliefs or reverence for the deceased). They share the same semantic predicate of cultural expression. Normalizing them to a single canonical_rel_name and description improves schema consistency, and mapping them to rel_cls_group 'REPRESENTATION' better captures that these are expressive/manifestative rather than pure identity relations.

executed_decisions.justification: All three relations connect ancient Egyptian burial practices to underlying beliefs or values they manifest (afterlife beliefs or reverence for the deceased). They share the same semantic predicate of cultural expression. Normalizing them to a single canonical_rel_name and description improves schema consistency, and mapping them to rel_cls_group 'REPRESENTATION' better captures that these are expressive/manifestative rather than pure identity relations.
